abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Seventh Transport Project in Haiti. The
            objectives of the project were to: (a) improve and
            rehabilitate roads and bridges;( b) improve coastal shipping
            operations; and (c) continue strengthening the sector
            institutions through programs of staff training and
            technical assistance. The overall rating of the project is
            just unsatisfactory. Bank’s performance was unsatisfactory
            in project’s identification, preparation and appraisal but
            was satisfactory in terms of supervision. Borrower’s
            performance was marginally satisfactory in preparation,
            unsatisfactory in implementation and deficient in compliance
            with loan covenants. The key lessons learned were: (i) an
            overall development plan should be established wherein the
            transport sector would be an instrumental component to
            facilitate the government's objectives; (ii) the
            transport infrastructure should assure the physical
            integrity of the country's network, through a careful
            planning process in order to optimize the funds assignment;
            and (iii) labor-intensive methods utilized  by small and
            medium contractors constitute a suitable tool to mitigate
            unemployment while achieving acceptable rehabilitation and
            maintenance work.
